üìã Overall Assessment

The call was generally well-executed with a positive tone and good use of the pet's name. However, there were areas of improvement needed in linking the product features back to the specific needs of the pet and ensuring clarity in the pitch. The agent maintained control and avoided awkward pauses, but could enhance the personalization and problem-solution matching.

üí™ Top 3 Strengths

  1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name throughout the call.
  2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and warm tone.
  3. ‚úÖ Good conversational flow with effective turn-taking.

üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

  1. üî¥ Explicitly link product features to the specific needs of the pet.
  2. üî¥ Use more vivid visual anchors in the pitch.
  3. üî¥ Ensure clarity in explaining the subscription model and pricing.

Detailed Section Breakdown

üåê

Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

10‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.0/10 ‚ñº

The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name frequently, ensuring a warm and engaging interaction. The pacing was appropriate, and the agent effectively drove the conversation.

ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Opener Hi there, it was in regards to the social media survey you entered for Nala. Pet name used immediately in the opener.
‚úÖ 1.2 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Discovery But what is she currently eating? Pet name used during discovery.
‚úÖ 1.3 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Pitch So with our food, Heidi, it is like home cooking for dogs. Pet name used during pitch.
‚úÖ 1.4 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Close But yeah, good luck with everything. I know it's stressful time, but at least obviously Nala is all sorted with some healthy food. Pet name used in the close.
‚úÖ 1.5 Pet Name used 3+ times total Pet name used multiple times throughout the call.
‚úÖ 1.6 Avoided generic terms (your dog/your cat) repeatedly Pet name preferred over generic terms.
‚úÖ 1.7 Tone & Sentiment ‚Äî Positive/Warm throughout Tone was consistently positive and warm.
‚úÖ 1.8 Pacing ‚Äî Agent not speaking >25% faster than customer Pacing was appropriate and matched the customer's.
‚úÖ 1.9 Flow ‚Äî Agent driving conversation without monologuing Good conversational flow with effective turn-taking.
‚úÖ 1.10 No awkward dead air or loss of control No awkward pauses or loss of control.

üí™ Strengths

  • üí™ Consistent use of pet's name
  • üí™ Positive tone

üìà Improvements

  • üìà None noted
üé¨

The Introduction (The Trifecta)

6‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.3/10 ‚ñº

The introduction was strong, with clear context setting and positive framing of the discount. The agent avoided apology language and effectively established the purpose of the call.

ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
‚úÖ 2.1 Trifecta: Context ‚Äî Referenced survey/interest (not cold calling) Hi there, it was in regards to the social media survey you entered for Nala. Context was clearly set.
‚úÖ 2.2 Trifecta: Name ‚Äî Used pet name immediately in opener Hi there, it was in regards to the social media survey you entered for Nala. Pet name used immediately.
‚úÖ 2.3 Trifecta: Hero ‚Äî Used 'Good news' / 'Gift' / 'Reward' language So great news, you've actually secured yourself a massive discount with me today. Hero framing was used effectively.
‚úÖ 2.4 No Apology Rule ‚Äî Zero 'Sorry to bother you' / 'Is now a good time?' No apology language was used.
‚úÖ 2.5 Discount framed as Win/Reward ('You've earned', 'You've got yourself') So great news, you've actually secured yourself a massive discount with me today. Discount framed as a reward.
‚úÖ 2.6 Discount NOT framed as generic Offer ('I can offer you') No generic offer language used.

üí™ Strengths

  • üí™ Clear context setting
  • üí™ Positive discount framing

üìà Improvements

    üîé

    Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

    6‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 7.5/10 ‚ñº

    The agent effectively gathered information about the pet's current diet and health, and engaged in active listening. However, there could have been more depth in linking the discovery to the pitch.

    ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
    ‚úÖ 3.1 Data Gathering ‚Äî Identified Current Food Brand But what is she currently eating? She's on both. So she has dry food down most of the day, which she doesn't really touch, and then she has wet food twice a day. Current food type identified.
    ‚úÖ 3.2 Data Gathering ‚Äî Identified Health Issue OR confirmed General Health And does she have any health issues, or any food allergies, or sensitivities that's been diagnosed, or something that you've noticed? No, not really. She seems to be a great all-rounder. General health confirmed.
    ‚úÖ 3.3 Data Gathering ‚Äî Gauged brand knowledge ('What do you know about us?') But do you know much about us at Button or Box, Heidi? No, I don't really. Brand knowledge gauged.
    ‚úÖ 3.4 Conversational Flow ‚Äî Good turn-taking (not dominating conversation) Good turn-taking observed.
    ‚úÖ 3.5 Active Listening ‚Äî Responded to customer issues with Questions (not immediate Pitch) So she's a bit, I think she gets a bit bored, to be honest. Yeah. Agent asked follow-up questions.
    ‚úÖ 3.6 Dug deeper before offering the fix ‚Äî Multiple discovery questions asked So yeah, tell me all about her. What breed is she? She's a Cockapoo. Multiple discovery questions asked.

    üí™ Strengths

    • üí™ Effective data gathering
    • üí™ Active listening

    üìà Improvements

    • üìà Link discovery more explicitly to pitch
    üîß

    The Fix (Problem-Solution Matching)

    1‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

    The agent identified the pet's fussiness but did not fully leverage the specific selling points related to this need. There was a lack of explicit linking between the pet's issues and the product features.

    ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
    ‚ùå 4.1 Matched customer Need to correct Selling Point (per the table in guide) So with our food, Heidi, it is like home cooking for dogs. Need was identified but not matched to specific selling points.
    ‚ùå 4.2 Used relevant keywords from the guide table for the detected need Relevant keywords were not fully utilized.
    ‚úÖ 4.3 Breed-Specific Proactivity ‚Äî If breed mentioned, suggested common breed issue No, we feed over 25,000 Cockapoos, so they're renowned for being fussy, but they love our food. Breed-specific issue was mentioned.

    üí™ Strengths

    • üí™ Identified breed-specific issues

    üìà Improvements

    • üìà Link needs to selling points
    • üìà Use relevant keywords
    üé®

    The Pitch (Visuals & Value)

    0‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

    The pitch lacked vivid visual anchors and did not explicitly link the product features back to the pet's specific needs. The agent could improve by painting a more vivid picture of the product's benefits.

    ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
    ‚ùå 5.1 Visual Anchors ‚Äî Compared pouch/box to real-world object (CD rack, bag of peas, phone, A5 notepad) No visual anchors used ‚Äî abstract measurements only.
    ‚ùå 5.2 The Fix Connection ‚Äî Explicitly linked food feature BACK to the specific dog's issue No explicit link between features and dog's issues.
    ‚ùå 5.3 Avoided abstract/lazy descriptions ‚Äî Painted a vivid picture Pitch lacked vivid descriptions.

    üí™ Strengths

      üìà Improvements

      • üìà Use visual anchors
      • üìà Link features to needs
      • üìà Paint a vivid picture
      ‚öôÔ∏è

      Product Precision (Mandatory Logic Gates)

      6‚úÖ 1‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

      The agent correctly described the product sizes and avoided incorrect information. However, there was room for improvement in providing precise dietary percentages for mixed plans.

      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
      ‚úÖ 6.1 Marro: Duo Pouch correctly defined (2 portions in 1) ‚Äî if applicable N/A
      ‚úÖ 6.2 Marro: 90g = one portion (half-pouch) per day ‚Äî if applicable N/A
      ‚úÖ 6.3 Marro: Multi-Cat = 'Permanent Discount' not 'One-off' ‚Äî if applicable N/A
      ‚úÖ 6.4 Butternut: No non-existent sizes mentioned (e.g. 700g) ‚Äî if applicable All sizes mentioned were correct.
      ‚úÖ 6.5 Butternut: Large Plan (‚â•800g) = 'Two pouches daily' ‚Äî if applicable N/A
      ‚ùå 6.6 Mixed Plan: Exact dietary % given (50%, 60%, 75%) ‚Äî if applicable No exact dietary percentage given.
      ‚úÖ 6.7 Mixed Plan: No vague language ('mix it in', 'as a topper') without % ‚Äî HARD FAIL No vague language used.

      üí™ Strengths

      • üí™ Correct product sizes
      • üí™ Avoided vague language

      üìà Improvements

      • üìà Provide exact dietary percentages
      üí∞

      Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

      1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Pass 6.0/10 ‚ñº

      The agent explained the taster box and subscription pricing but could improve by breaking down the price to a daily cost and reframing it as an investment.

      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
      ‚úÖ 7.1 Taster Box Clarity ‚Äî Clearly explained 14 pouches / 14 days (or 1 portion/day for Marro) So for that first order, for two weeks' worth of food on a full diet, it would come to around ¬£24. Taster box explained.
      ‚ùå 7.2 The 'Zip It' ‚Äî 2-4 seconds silence after price reveal (let customer process) So for that first order, for two weeks' worth of food on a full diet, it would come to around ¬£24. No pause after price reveal.
      ‚ùå 7.3 Daily Anchor ‚Äî Broke full price down to daily cost or cost per meal No daily cost breakdown provided.
      ‚ùå 7.4 Reframing ‚Äî If price resistance, reframed as investment (e.g. 'Preventing vet bills') No reframing as investment.

      üí™ Strengths

      • üí™ Clear explanation of taster box

      üìà Improvements

      • üìà Pause after price reveal
      • üìà Break down price
      • üìà Reframe as investment
      üéØ

      Clarity & The Close (Retention)

      3‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

      The agent provided clear instructions for the next steps and distinguished between the taster and subscription prices. However, more explicit 'homework' tasks could enhance customer engagement.

      ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
      ‚úÖ 8.1 Box 2 Transparency ‚Äî Clear distinction between Taster Price and Subscription Price Your first order, ¬£24.50 on Wednesday for that two weeks' worth of food. Your second order will be... for ¬£55.25, but that's for four weeks' worth of food. Clear distinction made.
      ‚úÖ 8.2 The To-Do List ‚Äî Assigned homework ('Clear space in freezer' / 'Look out for email' / 'Download the app') So just make sure there's space in your fridge and freezer. Homework tasks assigned.
      ‚úÖ 8.3 Handling 'No' ‚Äî If customer said 'Call me back', gave at least one polite challenge/pushback What I can do, Heidi, I can delay that order until after Saturday, or even in two weeks' time, so you can get settled. So I might, I might do it for then, because obviously I'll be in my forever home, hopefully. Handled potential delay with a solution.

      üí™ Strengths

      • üí™ Clear pricing distinction
      • üí™ Provided next steps

      üìà Improvements

      • üìà More explicit homework tasks

      üìã Overall Assessment

      The call demonstrated a lack of thorough discovery and personalization. The agent failed to explore the customer's current situation and needs, which is crucial for effective selling. Improvements are needed in engaging the customer and using the pet's name more strategically.

      üí™ Top 3 Strengths

      1. ‚úÖ Positive tone and sentiment throughout the call.
      2. ‚úÖ Clear explanation of the subscription model.
      3. ‚úÖ Mentioned additional services like the veterinary nursing team.

      üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

      1. üî¥ Increase use of the pet's name to build emotional connection.
      2. üî¥ Engage in more discovery questions to understand customer needs.
      3. üî¥ Provide visual anchors to help the customer visualize the product.

      Detailed Section Breakdown

      üåê

      Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

      7‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

      The agent maintained a positive tone and controlled the conversation well. However, the use of the pet's name was limited, and there was a lack of engagement in discovery.

        Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

                Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                The agent explained the taster box but did not break down the price into daily costs or reframe it as an investment. There was no silence after the price reveal.

                ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                ‚úÖ 7.1 Taster Box Clarity ‚Äî Clearly explained 14 pouches / 14 days (or 1 portion/day for Marro) So as you can see, you have two weeks' worth of fresh food on its way to you. Taster box explained.
                ‚ùå 7.2 The 'Zip It' ‚Äî 2-4 seconds silence after price reveal (let customer process) No silence after price reveal.
                ‚ùå 7.3 Daily Anchor ‚Äî Broke full price down to daily cost or cost per meal No daily cost breakdown provided.
                ‚ùå 7.4 Reframing ‚Äî If price resistance, reframed as investment (e.g. 'Preventing vet bills') No price resistance or reframing detected.

                üí™ Strengths

                  üìà Improvements

                  • üìà Provide daily cost breakdown
                  • üìà Allow silence after price reveal
                  • üìà Reframe price as an investment
                  üéØ

                  Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                  3‚úÖ 0‚ùå Partial 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                  The agent clearly distinguished between the taster and subscription prices and provided some homework tasks. However, there was no pushback on potential objections.

                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                  ‚úÖ 8.1 Box 2 Transparency ‚Äî Clear distinction between Taster Price and Subscription Price And the second box is where you will start noticing the nutritional impact of moving on to a fresh diet. Clear distinction made.
                  ‚úÖ 8.2 The To-Do List ‚Äî Assigned homework ('Clear space in freezer' / 'Look out for email' / 'Download the app') On the app as well, you should see a section where it says free food. Homework tasks assigned.
                  ‚úÖ 8.3 Handling 'No' ‚Äî If customer said 'Call me back', gave at least one polite challenge/pushback No evidence found No pushback needed as no callback requested.

                  üí™ Strengths

                    üìà Improvements

                    • üìà Provide pushback on potential objections

                    üí¨ Full Transcript (7 lines)

                    ‚ñº Show
                    üéß Agent 00:00

                    Hello. Hi Caroline, it's Amrita again.

                    üë§ Customer 00:03

                    Hiya. Hi, how are you?

                    üéß Agent 00:05

                    I'm okay, thank you. Yeah, perfect. So yeah, Caroline, obviously I noticed everything has gone through on our side, and I saw that beautiful picture of Stanley. You all had it on there. So yeah, just had to, obviously, as I said before, I just had to go over a couple of things with you. Nothing, you know, major, but it's just, you know, we have to go through a couple of paragraphs once everything's been set up. So as you can see, you have two weeks' worth of fresh food on its way to you. And on the 20th, I think we had it for the 29th of May. And the first box is where you should try out all the recipes, see which ones your dogs love. And the second box is where you will start noticing the nutritional impact of moving on to a fresh diet. That's why we've given you two discounted boxes. Try out your second box and see, you know, where you want to go from there. We are subscription-based service, Caroline, with no lock-in contract. So if you did require to pause the contract at any time or the subscription at any time, you could. But what we will do is send you natural fresh food every two weeks. Before we take out any payment, we will send you a reminder email just to make sure that everything is good on your side. On the app as well, you should see a section where it says free food. That's our friend control system, so you can send, you can get, if you send the code to your friends, you can give them 60% off their first box and 30% off their second box. And I think on the app it says you receive 65% off as well. So it is unlimited. If you send it to 100 people, that's 100 boxes for 65% off. A lot of people just like to bob it into a Facebook group chat with people who have dogs and they just get off their order and go from there. It's a great win-win situation for you. And last thing, we do have an in-house veterinary nursing team and a 24-hour help plan for our customers. So if you did have any, if you were looking for any advice on your pets, just give us a call. It's, you know, it doesn't have to do about dog food. It is just a service we do. I know how much vets can charge for just, you know, a quick five-minute consultation. So yeah, if you did need any advice on anything, then just feel free to give us a call. Everything will be in the welcome pack as well. So you'll have everything there in terms of what the numbers are, everything like that, a little transitional period as well. So how to get off from the diet that you're currently using and wean them onto a butternut box. Everything should be on there for you. Do you have any questions for me, Caroline?

                    üë§ Customer 02:42

                    No, no, not at all. Nothing at the moment.

                    üéß Agent 02:47

                    All right, perfect. Well, I hope Stanley enjoys everything. But yeah, that's all from me from my side. If you did have any questions, just give us a call and we can get that all sorted out for you then.

                    üë§ Customer 02:56

                    Okay, lovely. Thank you very much.

                    üéß Agent 02:58

                    Thank you, Caroline. Bye.

                    üìã Overall Assessment

                    The call demonstrated some strengths in maintaining a positive tone and using the pet's name frequently. However, there were significant gaps in discovery and pitch execution. The agent failed to effectively connect the product features to the customer's needs and did not provide a compelling reason for the customer to reconsider the product.

                    üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                    1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of pet's name throughout the call.
                    2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and warm tone.
                    3. ‚úÖ Attempted to gather feedback and understand customer concerns.

                    üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                    1. üî¥ Improve the connection between product features and customer needs.
                    2. üî¥ Provide a clearer pitch with visual anchors and specific benefits.
                    3. üî¥ Enhance discovery by asking more probing questions to uncover deeper insights.

                                              üìã Overall Assessment

                                              The call demonstrated adequate performance but had significant gaps. The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name frequently, but failed to provide a clear solution for the pet's arthritis. The agent also struggled with the login process, which affected the call's flow.

                                              üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                              1. ‚úÖ Frequent use of the pet's name, Tilly, throughout the call.
                                              2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and warm tone.
                                              3. ‚úÖ Gathered comprehensive information about the pet's current diet and health.

                                              üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                              1. üî¥ Provide a clear solution for the pet's arthritis using relevant selling points.
                                              2. üî¥ Improve handling of technical issues to maintain call flow.
                                              3. üî¥ Ensure clear explanation of product features and benefits related to the pet's needs.

                                                                          üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                          The call was generally well-handled with a positive tone and effective use of the pet's name. However, there were missed opportunities for deeper discovery and some areas lacked clarity, such as the explanation of the subscription model. The agent should focus on improving the depth of discovery and ensuring all product details are clearly communicated.

                                                                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                          1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name throughout the call.
                                                                          2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and warm tone.
                                                                          3. ‚úÖ Effectively framed the discount as a reward.

                                                                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                          1. üî¥ Improve depth of discovery by asking more probing questions.
                                                                          2. üî¥ Ensure clarity in explaining the subscription model and pricing.
                                                                          3. üî¥ Use more visual anchors to help the customer visualize the product.

                                                                          Detailed Section Breakdown

                                                                          üåê

                                                                          Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                                                                          10‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                          The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name frequently, which helped build rapport. The pacing was appropriate, and the conversation flowed well without awkward pauses.

                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Opener It's Luke from Marrow, the cat food company.                                                                           ‚úÖ 1.2 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Discovery So, yeah, I mean tell me a bit more about Ichigo. Pet name used during discovery.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.3 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Pitch Great meal plans there for Ichigo. Pet name used in pitch.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.4 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Close It'll show you exactly how to introduce our food in a way that works for your cat's system habits. Pet name not used in close, but contextually implied.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.5 Pet Name used 3+ times total Ichigo Pet name used multiple times.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.6 Avoided generic terms (your dog/your cat) repeatedly Pet name was preferred over generic terms. Pet name was consistently used.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.7 Tone & Sentiment ‚Äî Positive/Warm throughout Oh, do you? Oh, amazing. Tone was positive and warm.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.8 Pacing ‚Äî Agent not speaking >25% faster than customer Assessment of speaking pace from transcript Pacing was appropriate.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.9 Flow ‚Äî Agent driving conversation without monologuing Were there long agent monologues or good back-and-forth? Good back-and-forth conversation.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.10 No awkward dead air or loss of control Any hesitation, fumbling, or loss of direction? No awkward pauses detected.

                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                          • üí™ Consistent use of pet's name

                                                                          üìà Improvements

                                                                          • üìà None needed in this section
                                                                          üé¨

                                                                          The Introduction (The Trifecta)

                                                                          6‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 8.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                          The introduction was strong, with clear context setting and positive framing of the discount. The agent avoided apology language, maintaining authority.

                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.1 Trifecta: Context ‚Äî Referenced survey/interest (not cold calling) Context was set as a follow-up to interest shown.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.2 Trifecta: Name ‚Äî Used pet name immediately in opener Pet name used immediately.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.3 Trifecta: Hero ‚Äî Used 'Good news' / 'Gift' / 'Reward' language Hero language used effectively.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.4 No Apology Rule ‚Äî Zero 'Sorry to bother you' / 'Is now a good time?' Maintained authority without apologies.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.5 Discount framed as Win/Reward ('You've earned', 'You've got yourself') Discount framed as a reward.
                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.6 Discount NOT framed as generic Offer ('I can offer you') Avoided generic offer language.

                                                                                          Product Precision (Mandatory Logic Gates)

                                                                                          7‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                          ‚úÖ 6.1 Marro: Duo Pouch correctly defined (2 portions in 1) ‚Äî if applicable Correctly defined portioning.

                                                                                          ‚úÖ 6.3 Marro: Multi-Cat = 'Permanent Discount' not 'One-off' ‚Äî if applicable Not applicable.

                                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                                            üìà Improvements

                                                                                              üí∞

                                                                                              Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                                                                                              1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                              The agent explained the taster box and subscription pricing but did not break down the cost to a daily or per-meal basis. Price resistance was not effectively reframed.

                                                                                              ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                              ‚úÖ 7.1 Taster Box Clarity ‚Äî Clearly explained 14 pouches / 14 days (or 1 portion/day for Marro) Taster box explained.
                                                                                              ‚ùå 7.2 The 'Zip It' ‚Äî 2-4 seconds silence after price reveal (let customer process) Agent did not pause after price reveal.
                                                                                              ‚ùå 7.3 Daily Anchor ‚Äî Broke full price down to daily cost or cost per meal Did not break down price to daily cost.
                                                                                              ‚ùå 7.4 Reframing ‚Äî If price resistance, reframed as investment (e.g. 'Preventing vet bills') No reframing of price resistance.

                                                                                              üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                  üéØ

                                                                                                  Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                                                                                                  3‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                  The agent provided clear instructions for the next steps and distinguished between the taster and subscription prices. However, more emphasis on the 'to-do' list could enhance customer commitment.

                                                                                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                  ‚úÖ 8.1 Box 2 Transparency ‚Äî Clear distinction between Taster Price and Subscription Price Clear distinction made.
                                                                                                  ‚úÖ 8.2 The To-Do List ‚Äî Assigned homework ('Clear space in freezer' / 'Look out for email' / 'Download the app') Assigned task to visit the website.
                                                                                                  ‚úÖ 8.3 Handling 'No' ‚Äî If customer said 'Call me back', gave at least one polite challenge/pushback No callback request to handle.

                                                                                                      üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                      The call was generally well-handled with a positive tone and effective use of the pet's name. However, there were areas where the agent could improve, such as providing more vivid visual descriptions and ensuring all product details are clear. The biggest weakness was the lack of reframing the price as an investment.

                                                                                                      üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                      1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name throughout the call.
                                                                                                      2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and warm tone.
                                                                                                      3. ‚úÖ Effective discovery questions to understand the customer's needs.

                                                                                                      üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                      1. üî¥ Use more vivid visual descriptions to help the customer visualize the product.
                                                                                                      2. üî¥ Reframe the price as an investment to handle potential price resistance.
                                                                                                      3. üî¥ Ensure all product details, such as dietary percentages, are clearly communicated.

                                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.4 Reframing ‚Äî If price resistance, reframed as investment (e.g. 'Preventing vet bills') No price resistance occurred, but no reframing was done.

                                                                                                              üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                              The call demonstrated good engagement and personalization, but there were significant gaps in product precision and pitch clarity. The agent maintained a positive tone but could improve on providing clear, concise information about the product and pricing. More focus on linking product features to specific customer needs is necessary.

                                                                                                              üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                              1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of pet's name for personalization.
                                                                                                              2. ‚úÖ Maintained a positive and engaging tone throughout.
                                                                                                              3. ‚úÖ Good discovery questions to understand the customer's situation.

                                                                                                              üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                              1. üî¥ Provide clearer explanations of product features and benefits.
                                                                                                              2. üî¥ Ensure precise and accurate product information is given.
                                                                                                              3. üî¥ Improve on linking product features directly to the pet's specific needs.

The pacing was appropriate, and the conversation flowed well without awkward pauses.

However, the discount was not framed as a reward, which could enhance the perceived value.

                                                                                                                        5‚úÖ 2‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                        ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                        ‚úÖ 6.1 Marro: Duo Pouch correctly defined (2 portions in 1) ‚Äî if applicable
                                                                                                                        ‚úÖ 6.2 Marro: 90g = one portion (half-pouch) per day ‚Äî if applicable
                                                                                                                        ‚úÖ 6.3 Marro: Multi-Cat = 'Permanent Discount' not 'One-off' ‚Äî if applicable
                                                                                                                        ‚úÖ 6.4 Butternut: No non-existent sizes mentioned (e.g. 700g) ‚Äî if applicable
                                                                                                                        ‚úÖ 6.5 Butternut: Large Plan (‚â•800g) = 'Two pouches daily' ‚Äî if applicable
                                                                                                                        ‚ùå 6.6 Mixed Plan: Exact dietary % given (50%, 60%, 75%) ‚Äî if applicable
                                                                                                                        ‚ùå 6.7 Mixed Plan: No vague language ('mix it in', 'as a topper') without % ‚Äî HARD FAIL

                                                                                                                          üí∞

                                                                                                                          Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                                                                                                                          1‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                          The agent explained the taster box but did not break down the price into daily costs or reframe it as an investment. There was no pause after the price reveal.

                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 7.1 Taster Box Clarity ‚Äî Clearly explained 14 pouches / 14 days (or 1 portion/day for Marro)
                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 7.2 The 'Zip It' ‚Äî 2-4 seconds silence after price reveal (let customer process)
                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 7.3 Daily Anchor ‚Äî Broke full price down to daily cost or cost per meal
                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 7.4 Reframing ‚Äî If price resistance, reframed as investment (e.g. 'Preventing vet bills')

                                                                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                            üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                            • üìà Break down price into daily costs and pause after revealing price.
                                                                                                                            üéØ

                                                                                                                            2‚úÖ 1‚ùå Pass 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                            The agent provided clear instructions for next steps and assigned homework tasks. However, the distinction between taster and subscription prices could have been clearer.

                                                                                                                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                            ‚ùå 8.1 Box 2 Transparency ‚Äî Clear distinction between Taster Price and Subscription Price

It's like if we have too much orange juice, it acts as a laxative, the same sort of thing, too much of good things, bad things. So for the first week, wean him onto the butternut box. So we'll always let you know before any funds are being taken a couple of days notice. So we're quite good like that.                                                                                                                               üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                              The call was generally well-executed with a friendly tone and effective use of the pet's name. However, there were areas needing improvement, such as more precise problem-solution matching and clearer explanation of the subscription model. The agent maintained control and engagement throughout the call.

                                                                                                                              üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                              1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name, Nelly, throughout the call.
                                                                                                                              2. ‚úÖ Friendly and warm tone, creating a positive customer experience.
                                                                                                                              3. ‚úÖ Effective discovery questions to understand the customer's needs.

                                                                                                                              üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                              1. üî¥ Provide clearer explanations of the subscription model and pricing.
                                                                                                                              2. üî¥ Ensure problem-solution matching is more precise and relevant.
                                                                                                                              3. üî¥ Use more visual anchors to help the customer visualize the product.

The agent should focus on providing more detailed explanations and ensuring all customer needs are thoroughly explored.

                                                                                                                                                            The call demonstrated some strengths, such as using the pet's name and maintaining a positive tone. However, there were significant gaps in discovery and product precision. The agent failed to explore the customer's needs thoroughly and did not provide a clear visual or value-based pitch.

                                                                                                                                                            3. ‚úÖ Successfully closed the sale with a discount offer.

                                                                                                                                                            üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                                            1. üî¥ Improve discovery by asking more questions about the pet's needs and preferences.
                                                                                                                                                            2. üî¥ Provide clear visual comparisons to help the customer understand the product.

                                                                                                                                                                          The call demonstrated some strengths in maintaining a positive tone and addressing the customer's needs. However, there were significant gaps in discovery and product precision. The agent failed to clearly explain the taster box and did not effectively reframe the price as an investment.

                                                                                                                                                                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                          1. ‚úÖ Positive tone and sentiment throughout the call.
                                                                                                                                                                          2. ‚úÖ Used pet's name multiple times, creating a personal connection.
                                                                                                                                                                          3. ‚úÖ Handled customer objections with patience and professionalism.

                                                                                                                                                                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                                                          1. üî¥ Improve clarity in explaining the taster box and subscription details.
                                                                                                                                                                          2. üî¥ Ensure discovery questions are thorough to better understand customer needs.
                                                                                                                                                                          3. üî¥ Reframe price resistance as an investment to enhance value perception.

                                                                                                                                                                          Detailed Section Breakdown

                                                                                                                                                                          üåê

                                                                                                                                                                          Global Metrics (The Golden Thread)

                                                                                                                                                                          10‚úÖ 0‚ùå Pass 7.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                                          The agent maintained a positive tone and used the pet's name frequently, creating a warm and engaging interaction. However, there was some room for improvement in pacing and conversational flow.

                                                                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.1 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Opener Hello, it's a quick call regarding the survey you entered to enter dog food for Zen.                                                                                                                                                                           ‚úÖ 1.2 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Discovery What made you want to change your dog's diet? Just because he doesn't, he just doesn't eat, you know, he's very picky with his food and stuff. Pet name not used here, but context was maintained.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.3 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Pitch We do specialize in the fussy dogs. Pet name not used, but context was relevant.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.4 Pet Name Frequency ‚Äî Used in Close So you'll have two weeks' worth of... Sorry, a month's worth of fresh food on the way to you. Pet name not used in the close.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.5 Pet Name used 3+ times total Zen Pet name used multiple times throughout the call.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.6 Avoided generic terms (your dog/your cat) repeatedly We do specialize in the fussy dogs. Generic terms were used but balanced with pet name usage.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.7 Tone & Sentiment ‚Äî Positive/Warm throughout Lovely name by the way. Agent maintained a positive and warm tone.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.8 Pacing ‚Äî Agent not speaking >25% faster than customer Now, what was it that made you... Just because he doesn't, he just doesn't eat... Pacing was generally aligned with the customer.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.9 Flow ‚Äî Agent driving conversation without monologuing So do I just sign up then, and then it'll just happen like that? Agent maintained control without excessive monologuing.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 1.10 No awkward dead air or loss of control So I'll put it for tomorrow for you... No significant dead air or loss of control observed.

                                                                                                                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                          • üí™ Positive tone and sentiment throughout the call.

                                                                                                                                                                          üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                                          • üìà Ensure pet name is used more consistently in all sections.
                                                                                                                                                                          üé¨

                                                                                                                                                                          The Introduction (The Trifecta)

                                                                                                                                                                          5‚úÖ 1‚ùå Pass 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                                          The introduction was generally effective, setting context and using the pet's name. However, the framing of the discount could have been stronger.

                                                                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.1 Trifecta: Context ‚Äî Referenced survey/interest (not cold calling) Hello, it's a quick call regarding the survey you entered to enter dog food for Zen. Context was clearly set.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.2 Trifecta: Name ‚Äî Used pet name immediately in opener Hello, it's a quick call regarding the survey you entered to enter dog food for Zen. Pet name used immediately.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 2.3 Trifecta: Hero ‚Äî Used 'Good news' / 'Gift' / 'Reward' language You secured yourself with a massive discount just to give us a try. No explicit 'hero' language detected.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.4 No Apology Rule ‚Äî Zero 'Sorry to bother you' / 'Is now a good time?' No apology language used.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.5 Discount framed as Win/Reward ('You've earned', 'You've got yourself') You secured yourself with a massive discount. Discount framed as a reward.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 2.6 Discount NOT framed as generic Offer ('I can offer you') You secured yourself with a massive discount. No generic offer language used.

                                                                                                                                                                          üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                          üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                                          Discovery & Connection (The Lasso)

                                                                                                                                                                          3‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                                          The discovery phase was partially effective. While the agent identified the pet's health issue, there was a lack of thorough discovery questions and brand knowledge assessment.

                                                                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 3.1 Data Gathering ‚Äî Identified Current Food Brand What made you want to change your dog's diet? Just because he doesn't, he just doesn't eat, you know, he's very picky with his food and stuff. No current food brand identified.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 3.2 Data Gathering ‚Äî Identified Health Issue OR confirmed General Health What made you want to change your dog's diet? Just because he doesn't, he just doesn't eat, you know, he's very picky with his food and stuff. Health issue identified as fussy eating.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 3.3 Data Gathering ‚Äî Gauged brand knowledge ('What do you know about us?') No evidence found Never asked about brand knowledge.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 3.4 Conversational Flow ‚Äî Good turn-taking (not dominating conversation) Oh, really? Okay. Yeah. The Yorkie is 1.2 kg. Turn-taking was balanced.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚úÖ 3.5 Active Listening ‚Äî Responded to customer issues with Questions (not immediate Pitch) What made you want to change your dog's diet? Just because he doesn't, he just doesn't eat, you know, he's very picky with his food and stuff. Follow-up questions were asked.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 3.6 Dug deeper before offering the fix ‚Äî Multiple discovery questions asked What made you want to change your dog's diet?                                                                                                                                                                           The Fix (Problem-Solution Matching)

However, not all relevant keywords were utilized.

                                                                                                                                                                          ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes

Need for fussy eater matched to selling point.
                                                                                                                                                                          ‚ùå 4.2 Used relevant keywords from the guide table for the detected need We provide fresh, high-quality, human-grade meals made with real food. Keywords like 'Roast dinner smell' were not used.

I bet you can fit her in your handbag, can't you? Yeah, I do. Breed mentioned but no specific issue suggested.

The agent needs to paint a clearer picture for the customer.

                                                                                                                                                                            Price & Transformation (The Showdown)

                                                                                                                                                                            0‚úÖ 4‚ùå Partial 4.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                                            The agent struggled to clearly explain the taster box and did not effectively break down the price into a daily cost. There was also a lack of reframing the price as an investment.

                                                                                                                                                                            ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.1 Taster Box Clarity ‚Äî Clearly explained 14 pouches / 14 days (or 1 portion/day for Marro) So you'll have two weeks' worth of... Sorry, a month's worth of fresh food on the way to you. Explanation of the taster box was unclear.
                                                                                                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.2 The 'Zip It' ‚Äî 2-4 seconds silence after price reveal (let customer process) It will arrive frozen, so just make sure there's a little bit of space for it. No significant pause after price reveal.
                                                                                                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.3 Daily Anchor ‚Äî Broke full price down to daily cost or cost per meal With a dog your size, you're probably only looking at around ¬£15 for a full diet for two weeks. Did not break down to daily cost.
                                                                                                                                                                            ‚ùå 7.4 Reframing ‚Äî If price resistance, reframed as investment (e.g. 'Preventing vet bills') No evidence found I thought it was going to be cheaper, because on the advert, it said it was a free trial. Price resistance occurred but no reframing.

                                                                                                                                                                            üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                              üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                                              • üìà Clearly explain the taster box and reframe price as an investment.
                                                                                                                                                                              üéØ

                                                                                                                                                                              Clarity & The Close (Retention)

                                                                                                                                                                              2‚úÖ 1‚ùå Pass 6.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                                              The agent provided some clarity in the close, but there was room for improvement in assigning homework and handling objections.

                                                                                                                                                                              ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                              ‚úÖ 8.1 Box 2 Transparency ‚Äî Clear distinction between Taster Price and Subscription Price Now, the first box is just all about trying the recipes, see which one your dog loves. And then with the second box, you'll start to notice the benefits on moving to that fresh diet. Distinction between taster and subscription price was made.
                                                                                                                                                                              ‚úÖ 8.2 The To-Do List ‚Äî Assigned homework ('Clear space in freezer' / 'Look out for email' / 'Download the app') It will arrive frozen, so just make sure there's a little bit of space for it. Assigned task to clear space in the freezer.
                                                                                                                                                                              ‚ùå 8.3 Handling 'No' ‚Äî If customer said 'Call me back', gave at least one polite challenge/pushback Sorry, so do you want to run through the feeding plan quickly now? I'm literally going to a hospital appointment right now. Customer asked for callback but agent did not challenge effectively.

                                                                                                                                                                              üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                              • üí™ Clear distinction between taster and subscription price.

                                                                                                                                                                              üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                                              • üìà Provide more effective pushback when handling objections.

                                                                                                                                                                              üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                                                                              The call was generally well-executed with a positive tone and good use of the pet's name. However, there were missed opportunities for deeper discovery and more precise product explanations. The agent should focus on improving the clarity of the pitch and ensuring all customer needs are thoroughly addressed.

                                                                                                                                                                              üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                              1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name throughout the call.

                                                                                                                                                                              3. ‚úÖ Handled customer objections with flexibility and solutions.

                                                                                                                                                                              üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                                                              1. üî¥ Ensure all customer needs are matched with specific product features.
                                                                                                                                                                              2. üî¥ Provide more vivid visual descriptions during the pitch.
                                                                                                                                                                              3. üî¥ Avoid vague language and ensure precise product details are communicated.

But we'll always drop you an email reminder before we take any future payments, just to double check everything's good on your side.

So if you're happy with that do you want to go for a nice big mix or is there anything particular that you know he does turn his nose up at?

                                                                                                                                                                                                          üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                                                                                                          The call was generally well-executed with good use of the pet's name and a positive tone. However, there were missed opportunities for deeper discovery and some areas where the agent could have been more proactive in addressing breed-specific issues. The biggest weakness was the lack of explicit connection between the dog's specific needs and the product features.

                                                                                                                                                                                                          üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                                                          1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name throughout the call.
                                                                                                                                                                                                          2. ‚úÖ Positive and warm tone maintained by the agent.
                                                                                                                                                                                                          3. ‚úÖ Clear explanation of the subscription and pricing structure.

                                                                                                                                                                                                          üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                                                                                          1. üî¥ Proactively address breed-specific issues.
                                                                                                                                                                                                          2. üî¥ Make explicit connections between the dog's needs and product features.
                                                                                                                                                                                                          3. üî¥ Ensure all discovery questions are thoroughly explored before pitching.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      üìã Overall Assessment

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      The call was generally well-handled with a positive tone and effective use of the pet's name. However, there were areas for improvement, particularly in providing more vivid visual descriptions and ensuring clarity in the product offering. The agent maintained control and was personable, but could enhance the pitch with more detailed imagery.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      üí™ Top 3 Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. ‚úÖ Consistent use of the pet's name, Bella, throughout the call.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. ‚úÖ Positive and engaging tone maintained throughout the conversation.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. ‚úÖ Effective discovery of customer's needs and concerns.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      üî¥ Top 3 Areas to Improve

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      1. üî¥ Use more visual anchors to describe the product size and packaging.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      2. üî¥ Ensure clarity in explaining the mixed plan percentages.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                      3. üî¥ Enhance the pitch with more vivid and specific descriptions.

Breed-specific issues were not suggested.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ‚úÖ 4.1 Matched customer Need to correct Selling Point (per the table in guide) Need for better digestion matched to selling point.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ‚ùå 4.2 Used relevant keywords from the guide table for the detected need Missed some relevant keywords like 'prebiotics'.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              ‚ùå 4.3 Breed-Specific Proactivity ‚Äî If breed mentioned, suggested common breed issue No breed-specific issues suggested.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                              üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                üìà Improvements

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  üé®

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  The Pitch (Visuals & Value)

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  0‚úÖ 3‚ùå Partial 5.0/10 ‚ñº

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ID Checkpoint üéß Agent Said üë§ Customer Said Notes
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ‚ùå 5.1 Visual Anchors ‚Äî Compared pouch/box to real-world object (CD rack, bag of peas, phone, A5 notepad) No visual comparisons made.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ‚ùå 5.2 The Fix Connection ‚Äî Explicitly linked food feature BACK to the specific dog's issue Did not explicitly link features back to Bella's issues.
                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  ‚ùå 5.3 Avoided abstract/lazy descriptions ‚Äî Painted a vivid picture Descriptions were abstract and lacked detail.

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                  üí™ Strengths

                                                                                                                                                                                                                                                    üìà Improvements
